abstract.text: Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Implement custom low-latency drawing if your app doesn’t use PencilKit. Participate in UI updates and influence UI update behavior using
Offer a wider variety of marking tools by creating a configurable tool picker. Create a
, add standard system tools or define your own custom tools with
, and specify which order the tools appear in. Include an optional
in the tool picker to provide quick access to additional features directly from the picker.

Perform actions in your app in response to squeeze interactions on Apple Pencil Pro. People can choose their preferred squeeze action in Settings > Apple Pencil > Actions > Squeeze, such as switching drawing tools, showing a contextual palette, or performing an App Shortcut. You can also implement a custom action for squeeze and give people the choice to use your app’s custom behavior instead. In SwiftUI, use

Perform actions in your app in response to double-tap interactions on Apple Pencil. People can choose their preferred double-tap action in Settings > Apple Pencil > Actions > Double Tap. In SwiftUI, use
. In UIKit, update your implementation to use

Leverage the hover pose of Apple Pencil to support more complex interactions in response to a double tap or squeeze. Information about the hover pose — such as azimuth, altitude, and hover distance — is available when a person holds a supported model of Apple Pencil close to the screen during a double tap or squeeze. In SwiftUI, use
Provide tactile feedback on Apple Pencil Pro by playing haptics in response to certain actions, such as snapping objects to a grid. In SwiftUI, use
Track the barrel-roll angle of Apple Pencil Pro to create more expressive drawing experiences and hover previews using
Check the value of the hover tool preview preference from the Apple Pencil section of the Settings app using
Take advantage of barrel-roll tracking for Apple Pencil Pro when a person makes marker and fountain pen strokes. Support
, which includes the version of the inks that incorporate barrel-roll data.

abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
Learn about important changes to Core Location.
Enhance your iPad app’s user experience by supporting drawing, handwriting, and other features of Apple Pencil.
The PencilKit version that supports barrel-roll angle data in inks.
A tool palette that displays a selection of drawing tools and colors for tools that a person can choose from.
An optional button that appears at the trailing edge of the tool picker.
An item that represents a custom tool in the tool picker.
A value describing the location and distance of an Apple Pencil hovering in the area above a view’s bounds.
Represents a type of haptic and/or audio feedback that can be played.
Adds an action to perform after the user double-taps their Apple Pencil.
Adds an action to perform when the user squeezes their Apple Pencil.
The abstract superclass for all feedback generators.
An object that describes the hover pose of Apple Pencil during an interaction like double tap or squeeze.
A person’s preference for whether holding a supported model of Apple Pencil close to the screen shows a preview of the current drawing tool, as specified in the Settings app.
Tells the delegate when a person squeezes Apple Pencil.
Tells the delegate when a person double-taps Apple Pencil.
Tells the delegate that the user double-tapped Apple Pencil.
A value that represents the current barrel-roll angle of Apple Pencil.
An object you use to observe, participate in, and affect the UI update process.

featured.svg.alt: An icon, with a star and a speech bubble around it, representing updates.
